title: "Chant Anyway" by Srila Bhaktivinod Thakur | Soulful Japa
speaker: HDG Srila Prabhupada

segments.key_quote: Your mind is wandering all over the universe when you chant. Chant anyway.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada introduces Bhaktivinoda Thakur's 'Chant Anyway' and lists common obstacles encountered during chanting, emphasizing the importance of continuing despite them.
segments.transcript: I will put one writing of Bhaktivinoda Thakur. You read that. Then you will see how we should be towards, how our attitude should be towards the general population chanting Hare Krishna. This is Bhaktivinoda Thakur's Sharanagati, quoted from Adi Purana. It's called, chant anyway. It starts like this: Your mind is wandering all over the universe when you chant. Chant anyway. Your mind is wandering to the past and future when you chant. Chant anyway. You are not able to concentrate on Krishna's names while you chant. Chant anyway. You have no taste for chanting. Chant anyway. You have lusty desires. Chant anyway. You are making offenses in chanting. Chant anyway.

segments.key_quote: There is no vow like chanting the Holy Name. There's no knowledge superior to it.
segments.summary: This segment explains the unparalleled benefits of chanting the holy name, highlighting its superiority to vows, knowledge, meditation, and penance, and its power to grant liberation and joy.
segments.transcript: You are not praying to Krishna to help you chant better. Chant anyway. You often chant late at night. Chant anyway. And why, why should you chant despite all the above obstacles? That is why. What is that? There is no vow like chanting the Holy Name. There's no knowledge superior to it. There is no meditation which comes anywhere near it, and it gives the highest result. No penance is equal to it, and nothing is as potent or powerful as the holy name. Chanting is the greatest act of piety and the supreme refuge. Even the words of Vedas do not possess sufficient power to describe its magnitude. It's continuing. Chanting is the highest path to liberation, peace, and eternal life. It's a pinnacle of devotion, heart's joyous proclivity and attraction. See, it's a heart's joyous proclivity and attraction and the best form of remembrance of the Supreme Lord.

segments.key_quote: The holy name has appeared solely for the benefit of all living entities as their lord and master
segments.summary: The holy name is described as the supreme worshipable object, spiritual guide, and a direct manifestation of Krishna, capable of granting realization even to those who chant in their sleep.
segments.transcript: The holy name has appeared solely for the benefit of all living entities as their Lord and master, nama prabhu, their supreme worshipable object and their spiritual guide and mentor, who continuously chants Lord Krishna's holy name, even in his sleep, can easily realize that the name is a direct manifestation of Krishna Himself.

segments.key_quote: It is a means for everybody and doing proper japa mindful japa is also for everybody
segments.summary: Chanting is presented as accessible to everyone, regardless of their background or education, even farmers and uneducated individuals can be taught to chant and hear.
segments.transcript: of the influences of Kali Yuga. So we see that is why it's called yuga dharma, means it is a means for everybody, and doing proper japa, mindful japa, is also for everybody. We have realized that how the farmer also could do it. We are able to train ourselves in few days. We are able to do it. It's also for the common man. It does not need any big intellectual endeavor. It's not required, right? Even to an uneducated person, you can always teach him how to concurrently chant and hear. Done, done.

segments.key_quote: To do soulful japa you have to be a human being that's all you don't need very big education
segments.summary: Soulful japa is described as natural to the soul and requiring no special education, the lecture aims to simplify the process by addressing complications and encouraging awareness of one's desires and offering them to Krishna.
segments.transcript: As far as soulful japa is concerned, all the atma shaktis that we are talking about, sankalpa vikalpa, preiti, shratha, sharanagati, all these things are natural to the soul. It also does not need any education. So to do soulful japa, you have to be a human being, that's all. You don't need very big education. So much we need to discuss today to do soulful japa, because we have become very complicated. To reduce the complication, we have to tell all these things that might go the way anywhere, at least you catch, know where is your Asha, where is your Ichcha, you identify it's going on, and you have to offer all those things here.
